tasks: Review the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design (nngroup.com) and identify 3 areas where you can apply them in your current work. Document your findings in a 1-page report.
Create a list of 5 pain points from user research or validation projects, focusing on those that require more effective collaboration with stakeholders. Prioritize the most critical ones.
Design a simple wireframe for a hypothetical product feature using the 8-point grid system. Focus on creating a clear and consistent layout.
Conduct 1 user interview and document 3 pain points using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework. Analyze your own design decisions to identify potential collaboration gaps.
Redesign your portfolio's navigation using the 8-point grid system, focusing on clear typography and consistent spacing. Test it with a friend or colleague for feedback.
Create a mind map illustrating how Jakob’s Law applies to your current work. Identify areas where you can improve user experience.
Develop a more advanced wireframe for the hypothetical product feature, incorporating Miller’s Law and Aesthetic-Usability Effect principles. Test it with a usability heuristic checklist.
Collaborate with a colleague or friend on a small design project (e.g., redesigning a simple UI component). Focus on effective communication and active listening.
Write a 500-word blog post discussing the importance of user research in product strategy, referencing your own experiences as a Strategic Lead.
Conduct 2 user interviews and document 5 pain points using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework. Analyze your design decisions to identify areas for improvement in collaboration and communication.
Design a comprehensive usability heuristic checklist for your current work, incorporating Jakob’s Law and Miller’s Law principles. Test it with a colleague or friend.
Create a capstone project: Redesign a complex product feature using the 10 Usability Heuristics as a guide. Document your design decisions and testing results.

resources.readup: As a Strategic Lead UX Designer, you are the bridge between user needs and business goals, leveraging your expertise in UX Fundamentals, UI Craft & Visual Design, User Research & Validation, and Product Thinking & Strategy to craft intuitive and innovative experiences that drive business success. With a strong foundation in collaboration and communication, you will lead cross-functional teams to deliver design solutions that exceed expectations and leave a lasting impact on users and businesses alike.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Applying Occam's Razor for Data-Driven Design Decisions
topics.summary: Developing the ability to make data-driven design decisions by applying Occam's Razor will help Strategic Leads optimize their design process and deliver more effective solutions.
practice_points: Analyze 3 existing design projects using Occam's Razor to identify areas for improvement and document findings in a written report
Create a decision-making framework with clear criteria for evaluating design options using Occam's Razor
Conduct an A/B testing experiment on a design concept using Occam's Razor to inform design decisions

topics.name: Mastering the Laws of UX: Jakob’s Law and Doherty Threshold
topics.summary: Understanding Jakob’s Law and Doherty Threshold will enable Strategic Leads to create more intuitive and user-friendly interfaces, resulting in improved user experience.
practice_points: Design 2 wireframes that incorporate Jakob’s Law and document the design decisions
Conduct a usability test using Doherty Threshold to identify areas for improvement on an existing product
Create a visual guide illustrating how to apply Jakob’s Law and Doherty Threshold in UI design

topics.name: Developing User Research Skills: Conducting Interviews with the Jobs-to-be-Done Framework
topics.summary: Refining user research skills by conducting interviews using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework will enable Strategic Leads to gain a deeper understanding of users' needs and create more effective solutions.
practice_points: Conduct 3 user interviews using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework and document findings in a written report
Create an interview guide with clear questions and criteria for evaluating user responses
Analyze and present the findings from 2 user interviews using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework to inform design decisions

insights.brief: Strategic Leads should possess a deep understanding of UX principles to ensure user-centered design.
insights.detailed: A strong foundation in UX fundamentals is crucial for Strategic Leads, as it enables them to create intuitive and accessible designs. However, the current score of 100/100 indicates that there may be room for improvement in applying these principles in real-world scenarios.
actionable: Attend UX design workshops or conferences to stay updated on industry trends and best practices
Review and analyze existing UX design projects to identify areas for improvement
Develop a personal project that showcases your understanding of UX fundamentals

insights.brief: Strategic Leads should have expertise in UI craft and visual design to create visually appealing and effective interfaces.
insights.detailed: A high score of 100/100 indicates that Strategic Leads possess strong skills in UI craft and visual design, but it's essential to continue refining their abilities to stay competitive. Effective visual design can significantly impact user engagement and overall experience.
actionable: Join online communities or forums focused on UI design to learn from others and share knowledge
Participate in design challenges or hackathons to practice and improve your skills
Collaborate with other designers or developers on a project to gain new insights

insights.brief: Strategic Leads should prioritize user research and validation to ensure that designs meet user needs and expectations.
insights.detailed: A score of 96/100 indicates that Strategic Leads are well-versed in user research and validation methods, but there may be opportunities to further improve their skills. Effective user research can help identify usability issues and inform design decisions.
actionable: Conduct user interviews or surveys to gather feedback on existing designs or prototypes
Use usability testing tools to analyze user interactions with interfaces
Develop a personal project that incorporates user research and validation

insights.brief: Strategic Leads should have a deep understanding of product thinking and strategy to drive business growth and success.
insights.detailed: A perfect score of 100/100 indicates that Strategic Leads possess strong knowledge of product thinking and strategy, but it's essential to continue refining their skills in this area. Effective product thinking can help identify opportunities for innovation and growth.
actionable: Read industry publications or blogs focused on product strategy and thinking
Attend product management conferences or workshops to learn from experts
Develop a personal project that incorporates product thinking and strategy

insights.brief: Strategic Leads should be skilled in collaboration and communication to effectively work with cross-functional teams.
insights.detailed: A score of 95/100 indicates that Strategic Leads are well-versed in collaboration and communication, but there may be opportunities to further improve their skills. Effective collaboration can help drive project success and ensure that all stakeholders are aligned.
actionable: Participate in team-building activities or workshops to improve collaboration skills
Join a professional organization or networking group focused on design or product management
Develop a personal project that requires collaboration with others
